Animation.name: Animation
Animation.description: Use an array of bones to create a skeleton that can be used by a SkinnedMesh.

Input.name: Input
Input.description:
Gamepad provides basic support for gamepads.

Some gamepads require a button press to being detected.

Gamepad implementation across browsers is still fragmented, every browser implements it a bit differently, so test it on every target before deploying an application using it.

For more information about the Gamepad API state take look at the W3C Gamepad API page https:// www.w3.org/TR/gamepad/.

Loaders.name: Loaders
Loaders.description: Audio loader can be used to load external audio resources.

Audio.name: Audio
Audio.description: AudioEmitter is a Object3D used to play audio inside the scene.

Misc.name: Misc
Misc.description:
Groups are used to group objects together.

They are not drawn in the scene are just used as logic containers.

Cameras.name: Cameras
Cameras.description:
Orthographic Camera is used for 2D like image projection.

Based on OrthographicCamera, original documentation available at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Cameras/OrthographicCamera.

Controls.name: Controls
Controls.description:
First person controls can be controlled using the mouse and keyboard.

Provides a navigations system familiar to the one found on FPS games.

The mouse left button can be used to look around, and the keyboard arrows for movement.

Lights.name: Lights
Lights.description:
Sky class if composed of a HemisphereLight, DirectionalLight and a dynamic generated Sky sphere geometry.

This object is composed by 3 internal objects
	- Hemisphere light
	- Directional Light
	- Mesh

Meshes.name: Meshes
Meshes.description:
Special mesh type used to draw 3D text.

It receives a Font resource that is used to triangulate and extrude font data into a 3D mesh.

Particles.name: Particles
Particles.description:
Particle emitter is a wrapper for SPE particle system.

SPE is a threejs based particle emitter engine.

Documentation for SPE particle engine can be found here https:// squarefeet.github.io/ShaderParticleEngine/docs/api/index.html

Physics.name: Physics
Physics.description:
Physics generator is used to create Cannon.js shapes from three.js geometries.

Can be used with any object that contains a geometry.

It is based on the original Mesh2Shape converted by @donmccurdy.

Script.name: Script
Script.description:
Base node are used as a basis for all other nodes, they implement the necessary common functionality for all nodes.

Base nodes add a destructible function with a button which allows the user to destroy them.

When the node gets destroyed it automatically gets removed from the graph.

Animations.name: Animations
Animations.description:
Spine animation object, to used with animation produced inside Esoteric spine. These animations are created using the Spine animation studio software.

Based on the official three.js runtime code available at https:// github.com/EsotericSoftware/spine-runtimes.

More information about spine available at www.esotericsoftware.com.

Textures.name: Textures
Textures.description:
Canvas textures can be used to draw content to the texture during runtime, using the context property.

Canvas textures always start with black background and a red text "Canvas Texture".

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description:
Sprites allways face the screen are used for 2D elements.

Based on Sprite documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Objects/Sprite.

Core.name: Core
Core.description:
Program class contains all the data of a nunuStudio program.

Is stores and manages all available resources used by the children objects.

Is responsible for handling runtime tasks, initialization, update, resizes etc.

Postprocessing.name: Postprocessing
Postprocessing.description:
Fast approximate anti-aliasing (FXAA) is an anti-aliasing algorithm to smooth jagged edges on post procesing effects.

More information about FXAA available here:
 - https:// developer.download.nvidia.com/assets/gamedev/files/sdk/11/FXAA_WhitePaper.pdf
Postprocessing.author: miibond

Resources.name: Resources
Resources.description: Audio class is used to store audio data as a arraybuffer to be later used by objects with the WebAudio API.

THREE.name: THREE
THREE.description:
Fog class is used to store fog attributes attached to a Scene

Original documentation for fog available here https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Scenes/Fog and for exponential fog here https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Scenes/FogExp2

BinaryUtils.name: BinaryUtils
BinaryUtils.description: ArraybufferUtils contains methods to convert from and to ArrayBuffer binary format

Utils.name: Utils
Utils.description:
EventManager is used to manager DOM events creationg and destruction in a single function call.

It is used by objects to make it easier to add, manager and remove events from DOM elements.

Runtime.name: Runtime
Runtime.description:
nunuStudio core main file.

Store development version, timestamp and contains global method to check browser feature support.

Files.name: Files
Files.description:
FileSystem is used to read and write files using nunuStudio.

Its implements multiple solutions for each method depending on the platform (NodeJS, brower or cordova).

Some operations are platform specific and might not work everywhere.

AnimationMixer.name: AnimationMixer
AnimationMixer.description:
The AnimationMixer is a player for animations on a particular object in the scene.

When multiple objects in the scene are animated independently, one AnimationMixer may be used for each object.

The object stores animations in its animations attribute, wich is an array an of animation clips.

params.name: root
params.description: Animation root object

TwistModifier.name: TwistModifier
TwistModifier.description:
The twist modifier applies a tornado twist like deformation to the geometry.

It follows a vector from a start to and end point in the vector and rotates all vertex for each point up to a defined final angle.

CapsuleBufferGeometry.name: CapsuleBufferGeometry
CapsuleBufferGeometry.description:
Capsule like geometry shape consisting of a cylinder with hemispherical ends.

The geometry is fully configurable booth in size and details, and can also be used to generate sections of capsule.
CapsuleBufferGeometry.author: maximequiblier

ParametricBufferGeometry.name: ParametricBufferGeometry
ParametricBufferGeometry.description:
Parametric bufffer geometry are constructed from javascript code describing a parametric surface.

A parametric function receives a (u, v) coordinate value and returns a Vector3 with the surface point for those values.

(u, v) values are normalized and might need readjusting to match the parametric function generator domain.

params.name: code
params.description: Javascript code that receive (u: number, v: number, target?: Vector3) as parameters, the target paramter might be undefined.

params.name: slices
params.description: The count of slices to use for the parametric function.

params.name: stacks
params.description: The count of stacks to use for the parametric function.

RoundedBoxBufferGeometry.name: RoundedBoxBufferGeometry
RoundedBoxBufferGeometry.description:
Rounded corners box buffer geometry, composed of a box with spherical corners and cylindrical edges.

The rounded parts of the geometry can be configured in detail level.
RoundedBoxBufferGeometry.author: pailhead / http://dusanbosnjak.com

TerrainBufferGeometry.name: TerrainBufferGeometry
TerrainBufferGeometry.description:
Terrrain geometry is a plane like geometry deformed by a height map texture.

This geometry type can be used to create large terrains. Its possible to generate the height data using scripts and create terrain dynamically.

params.name: width
params.description: Width of the terrain.

params.name: height
params.description: Height of the terrain.

params.name: widthSegments
params.description: How many segments compose the terrain width.

params.name: heightSegments
params.description: How many segments compose the terrain height.

params.name: scale
params.description: Scale of the terrain in height (maximum altitude of the terrain).

params.name: image
params.description: Image containing the height data of the terrain.

Gamepad.name: Gamepad
Gamepad.description:
Gamepad provides basic support for gamepads.

Some gamepads require a button press to being detected.

Gamepad implementation across browsers is still fragmented, every browser implements it a bit differently, so test it on every target before deploying an application using it.

For more information about the Gamepad API state take look at the W3C Gamepad API page https:// www.w3.org/TR/gamepad/.

Gyroscope.name: Gyroscope
Gyroscope.description: Gyroscope object can be used to get the orientation from the device.

Key.name: Key
Key.description: Key is used by Keyboard, Mouse, etc, to represent a key state.

Keyboard.name: Keyboard
Keyboard.description:
Keyboard instance for input in sync with the running application, internally stores the key transitions provided by the browser.

Allow to detect every key press, release event in sync with the app frame update.

The keyboard object provided by scripts is automatically updated by the runtime handler.

params.name: dontInitialize
params.description: If true the mouse events are not created.

Mouse.name: Mouse
Mouse.description:
Mouse instance for sync input the mouse should be updated everytime before.

Automatically calculates the diff of position between frames.

The mouse object provided by scripts is automatically updated by the runtime handler.

params.name: domElement
params.description: DOM element to craete the mouse events.

params.name: dontInitialize
params.description: If true the mouse events are not created.

TizenKeyboard.name: TizenKeyboard
TizenKeyboard.description:
Tizen keyboard contains codes of multiple tizen specific key codes.

These key codes are used in Samsung Tizen TV, more infomration available
 - https:// developer.samsung.com/stream-code101/tv/using-the-remote-control

AudioLoader.name: AudioLoader
AudioLoader.description: Audio loader can be used to load external audio resources.

FontLoader.name: FontLoader
FontLoader.description: FontLoader can be used to load external font resources.

GeometryLoader.name: GeometryLoader
GeometryLoader.description: Geometry loader can be used to load geometry files.

ImageLoader.name: ImageLoader
ImageLoader.description: ImageLoader can be used to load external image resources.

LegacyGeometryLoader.name: LegacyGeometryLoader
LegacyGeometryLoader.description:
Legacy geometry loader is used to load the old geometry file format.

May be necessary to load old project files.
LegacyGeometryLoader.author: alteredq / http:// alteredqualia.com/

MaterialLoader.name: MaterialLoader
MaterialLoader.description: MaterialLoader can be used to load external materials.

ObjectLoader.name: ObjectLoader
ObjectLoader.description:
Objectloader can be used to load external objects from files.

Also loads all resources attached to the objects being loaded.

Can parse be used to load on runtime resources and objects from external project files.

TextureLoader.name: TextureLoader
TextureLoader.description: TextureLoader can be used to load external textures.

VideoLoader.name: VideoLoader
VideoLoader.description: VideoLoader can be used to load external video resources.

AudioEmitter.name: AudioEmitter
AudioEmitter.description: AudioEmitter is a Object3D used to play audio inside the scene.
AudioEmitter.author: Reece Aaron Lecrivain

params.name: audio
params.description: Audio used by this emitter

PositionalAudio.name: PositionalAudio
PositionalAudio.description:
PositionalAudio is used to play audio with positional audio effect using a WebAudio panner.

Using the positional audio object the sound is controlled by the camera that renders first in the scene.

params.name: audio
params.description: Audio used by this emitter

CubeCamera.name: CubeCamera
CubeCamera.description:
Reflection probes are used to create CubeTextures dinamically.

These CubeTextures can be attributed to materials programatically.

OrthographicCamera.name: OrthographicCamera
OrthographicCamera.description:
Orthographic Camera is used for 2D like image projection.

Based on OrthographicCamera, original documentation available at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Cameras/OrthographicCamera.

params.name: size
params.description: Camera size relative to resize mode

params.name: aspect
params.description: Aspect ratio X/Y

params.name: mode
params.description: Camera resize mode (RESIZE_HORIZONTAL or RESIZE_VERTICAL)

params.name: near
params.description: Near projection plane

params.name: far
params.description: Far projection plane

PerspectiveCamera.name: PerspectiveCamera
PerspectiveCamera.description:
Perspective camera, used for 3D scenes with objects getting smaller as they get away from the camera.

Based on PerspectiveCamera, original documentation available at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Cameras/PerspectiveCamera.

params.name: fov
params.description: Field of view

params.name: aspect
params.description: Aspect ratio

params.name: near
params.description: Near projection plane (how closer can be objects visible by this camera)

params.name: far
params.description: Far projection plane (how far can be objects visible by this camera)

Viewport.name: Viewport
Viewport.description:
The viewport object is used to handle virtual visualization windows for the WebGL renderer.

It uses normalized coordinates [0 to 1] when using RELATIVE mode or pixel based coordinated for ABSOLUTE mode.

FirstPersonControls.name: FirstPersonControls
FirstPersonControls.description:
First person controls can be controlled using the mouse and keyboard.

Provides a navigations system familiar to the one found on FPS games.

The mouse left button can be used to look around, and the keyboard arrows for movement.

OrbitControls.name: OrbitControls
OrbitControls.description:
Orbit controls object can be controlled using the mouse.

It can be rotated using the mouse left button, moved with the mouse right button or mouse wheel.

AmbientLight.name: AmbientLight
AmbientLight.description:
Ambient lights are used to create base ilumanition for the scene.

They are not influenced by position, scale or rotation.

Based on AmbientLight documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Lights/AmbientLight

params.name: hex
params.description: Light color in hex RGB

DirectionalLight.name: DirectionalLight
DirectionalLight.description:
A light that gets emitted in a specific direction.

This light will behave as though it is infinitely far away and the rays produced from it are all parallel.

Based on DirectionalLight documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Lights/DirectionalLight

params.name: hex
params.description: Light color in hex RGB

params.name: intensity
params.description: Light intensity

DirectionalLightCSM.name: DirectionalLightCSM
DirectionalLightCSM.description:
A light that gets emitted in a specific direction and has a cascaded shadow map set.

Allows to project shadows over large distances by spliting the shadow frustum sections into multiple shadow maps with diferent resolution.

HemisphereLight.name: HemisphereLight
HemisphereLight.description:
A light source positioned directly above the scene, with color fading from the sky color to the ground color.

Based on HemisphereLight documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Lights/HemisphereLight

params.name: skyColor
params.description: Sky light color in hex RGB

params.name: groundColor
params.description: Ground light color in hex RGB

params.name: intensity
params.description: Light intensity

LightProbe.name: LightProbe
LightProbe.description: A LightProbe is a source of indirect-diffuse light.

params.name: sh
params.description: Light color in hex RGB

params.name: intensity
params.description: Light intensity

PointLight.name: PointLight
PointLight.description:
PointLights emit light from a single point in all directions.

Based on PointLight documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Lights/PointLight

params.name: hex
params.description: Light color in hex RGB

params.name: intensity
params.description: Light intensity

params.name: distance
params.description: Maximum PointLight range

RectAreaLight.name: RectAreaLight
RectAreaLight.description:
A RectAreLight emit light from a rectagular surface.

Based on RectAreaLight documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Lights/RectAreaLight

params.name: color
params.description: Light color in hex RGB

params.name: intensity
params.description: Light intensity

SpotLight.name: SpotLight
SpotLight.description:
A SpotLight emit light from a point in a specific direction in a cone volume.

SpotLight has a target that is always represented in words coordinates, and can be moved to change where the light is pointing at.

Based on SpotLight documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Lights/SpotLight

params.name: color
params.description: Light color in hex RGB

params.name: intensity
params.description: Light intensity

params.name: distance
params.description: SpotLight maximum range

InstancedMesh.name: InstancedMesh
InstancedMesh.description:
A instanced mesh is a mesh that can be drawn multiple times at once, it can be used to optimize the draw of large amount of the same geometry material combination.

The usage of InstancedMesh will help you to reduce the number of draw calls and thus improve the overall rendering performance in your application.

params.name: geometry
params.description: Geometry used by this mesh

params.name: material
params.description: Material used to shade the superficie of the geometry

Mesh.name: Mesh
Mesh.description:
A Mesh combines a geometry and a material forming a complete rederizable object.

Based on Mesh documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Objects/Mesh.

params.name: geometry
params.description: Geometry used by this mesh

params.name: material
params.description: Material used to shade the superficie of the geometry

SkinnedMesh.name: SkinnedMesh
SkinnedMesh.description:
SkinnedMesh is a Mesh that has a Skeleton attached.

A skeleton contains bones that are used to animate the vertices of the geometry.

Based on SkinnedMesh documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Objects/SkinnedMesh

params.name: geometry
params.description: Geometry used by this mesh

params.name: material
params.description: Material used to shade the superficie of the geometry

Group.name: Group
Group.description:
Groups are used to group objects together.

They are not drawn in the scene are just used as logic containers.

HTMLView.name: HTMLView
HTMLView.description:
HTMLView object is used to navigate webpages inside of the 3D scene.

Can be used to display external web widget using a iframe. Some pages might present limitations regarding their usage inside of a iframe element.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to be opened by default.

LensFlare.name: LensFlare
LensFlare.description:
LensFlare object can be used to simulate lens flare from lights.

Stores a list of Flares.

For optimal result LensFlare object should be attached to a light source.

Works with perspective and orthographic cameras.
LensFlare.author: tentone

Sky.name: Sky
Sky.description:
Sky class if composed of a HemisphereLight, DirectionalLight and a dynamic generated Sky sphere geometry.

This object is composed by 3 internal objects
	- Hemisphere light
	- Directional Light
	- Mesh

params.name: autoUpdate
params.description: If true sky auto updated its state

params.name: dayTime
params.description: Day duration in seconds

params.name: sunDistance
params.description: Distance of the sun

params.name: time
params.description: Starting time

ParticleEmitterControlOptions.name: ParticleEmitterControlOptions
ParticleEmitterControlOptions.description: A map of options to configure an ParticleEmitterControl instance.

params.name: options
params.description: A map of options to configure the emitter.

{Object} ParticleGroupOptions.name: {Object} ParticleGroupOptions
{Object} ParticleGroupOptions.description: A map of options to configure an ParticleGroup instance.

params.name: texture.value
params.description: An instance of Texture.

params.name: texture.frames
params.description: A Vector2 instance describing the number of frames on the x- and y-axis of the given texture. If not provided, the texture will NOT be treated as a sprite-sheet and as such will NOT be animated.

params.name: texture.frameCount
params.description: The total number of frames in the sprite-sheet.                                Allows for sprite-sheets that don't fill the entire                                texture.

params.name: texture.loop
params.description: The number of loops through the sprite-sheet that should   be performed over the course of a single particle"s lifetime.

params.name: fixedTimeStep
params.description: If no dt (or deltaTime) value is passed to this group"s    tick() function, this number will be used to move the particle    simulation forward. Value in SECONDS.

params.name: hasPerspective
params.description: Whether the distance a particle is from the camera should affect the particle"s size.

params.name: colorize
params.description: Whether the particles in this group should be rendered with color, or whether the only color of particles will come from the provided texture.

params.name: blending
params.description: One of Three.js"s blending modes to apply to this group"s ShaderMaterial.

params.name: transparent
params.description: Whether these particle"s should be rendered with transparency.

params.name: alphaTest
params.description: Sets the alpha value to be used when running an alpha test on the texture.value property. Value between 0 and 1.

params.name: depthWrite
params.description: Whether rendering the group has any effect on the depth buffer.

params.name: depthTest
params.description: Whether to have depth test enabled when rendering this group.

params.name: fog
params.description: Whether this group"s particles should be affected by their scene"s fog.

params.name: scale
params.description: The scale factor to apply to this group"s particle sizes. Useful for setting particle sizes to be relative to renderer size.

ParticleGroup.name: ParticleGroup
ParticleGroup.description: The ParticleGroup class. Creates a new group, containing a material, geometry, and mesh.
ParticleGroup.author: Luke Moody

params.name: options
params.description: A map of options to configure the group instance.

ShaderUtils.name: ShaderUtils
ShaderUtils.description: A bunch of utility functions used throughout the library.
ShaderUtils.author: Luke Moody

ShaderAttribute.name: ShaderAttribute
ShaderAttribute.description: A helper to handle creating and updating a BufferAttribute instance.
ShaderAttribute.author: Luke Moody

params.name: type
params.description: The buffer attribute type. See ShaderAttribute.typeSizeMap for valid values.

params.name: dynamicBuffer
params.description: Whether this buffer attribute should be marked as dynamic or not.

params.name: arrayType
params.description: A reference to a TypedArray constructor. Defaults to Float32Array if none provided.

TypedArrayHelper.name: TypedArrayHelper
TypedArrayHelper.description:
A helper class for TypedArrays.

Allows for easy resizing, assignment of various component-based types (e.g. Vector2, Vector3, Mat3, Color, ...) Numbers, and setting from other TypedArrays.
TypedArrayHelper.author: Luke Moody

params.name: TypedArrayConstructor
params.description: The constructor to use (Float32Array, Uint8Array, etc.)

params.name: size
params.description: The size of the array to create

params.name: componentSize
params.description: The number of components per-value (ie. 3 for a vec3, 9 for a Mat3, etc.)

params.name: indexOffset
params.description: The index in the array from which to start assigning values. Default 0 if none provided

ParticleDistributions.name: ParticleDistributions
ParticleDistributions.description:
A map of supported distribution types used by ParticleEmitterControl instances.

These distribution types can be applied to an emitter globally, which will affect the position, velocity, and acceleration value calculations for an emitter, or they can be applied on a per-property basis.

ParticleEmitter.name: ParticleEmitter
ParticleEmitter.description:
Particle emitter is a wrapper for SPE particle system.

SPE is a threejs based particle emitter engine.

Documentation for SPE particle engine can be found here https:// squarefeet.github.io/ShaderParticleEngine/docs/api/index.html

PhysicsObject.name: PhysicsObject
PhysicsObject.description:
Wrapper for cannon.js physics objects.

The editor includes tools to create cannon shapes from three.js geometry objects.

Documentation for cannon.js physics available here http:// schteppe.github.io/cannon.js/docs/

BaseNode.name: BaseNode
BaseNode.description:
Base node are used as a basis for all other nodes, they implement the necessary common functionality for all nodes.

Base nodes add a destructible function with a button which allows the user to destroy them.

When the node gets destroyed it automatically gets removed from the graph.

OperationNode.name: OperationNode
OperationNode.description: Operation nodes can be used for simple math operations with two input values.

params.name: operation
params.description: Math operation symbol to be performed.

NodeScript.name: NodeScript
NodeScript.description:
Node scripts are build using a graph composed of operations.

They can be used to create interaction without requiring any coding, logic can be build from provided blocks.

PythonScript.name: PythonScript
PythonScript.description:
Python scripts are similar to Script object by are written using the Python programming language.

Support for Python is provided using the Brython (https://github.com/brython-dev/brython) transpiler.

It is not possible to include external python code and libraries to the script.

params.name: code
params.description: Code to be used by this script

Script.name: Script
Script.description:
Script objects are used to control other objects present in the scene.

These scripts can access everything inside of the program where they are running they should be used to control logic aspect of the application.

Its possible to extend these scripts by using libraries that can be imported using the include() function provided. Libraries can be stored locally on the project or loaded from remote sources.

params.name: code
params.description: Javascript code to be used by this script

params.name: mode
params.description: Mode used to import external code into the script.

SpineAnimation.name: SpineAnimation
SpineAnimation.description:
Spine animation object, to used with animation produced inside Esoteric spine. These animations are created using the Spine animation studio software.

Based on the official three.js runtime code available at https:// github.com/EsotericSoftware/spine-runtimes.

More information about spine available at www.esotericsoftware.com.

params.name: json
params.description: Object containing the spine JSON encoded data for this animation.

params.name: atlas
params.description: Atlas file path.

params.name: path
params.description: Path to retrieve images from.

params.name: textures
params.description: List of textures provided for this animation.

SpineTexture.name: SpineTexture
SpineTexture.description:
Spine animation textures are used alognside with SpineAnimation objects.

Each animations sprite atlas uses a SpineTexture object.

params.name: texture
params.description: Texture to be used inside of this spine texture.

CanvasSprite.name: CanvasSprite
CanvasSprite.description:
Canvas sprite is used to render canvas based elements in a 2D canvas.

The sprite can be configured to keep a relative size to the screen of an absolute size.

Sprite.name: Sprite
Sprite.description:
Sprites allways face the screen are used for 2D elements.

Based on Sprite documentation for the object can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Objects/Sprite.

params.name: material
params.description: Material used to draw sprites

TextBitmap.name: TextBitmap
TextBitmap.description:
Text bitmap atlas with support for signed distance field data.

Input data should be composed of a BMFont file (can be a .fnt, .json. etc) file and a character atlas texture from an image.

Font atlas can be generate using the tool http:// www.angelcode.com/products/bmfont/

Based on the three-bmfont-text library.
 - https:// github.com/Jam3/three-bmfont-text
 - https:// github.com/Jam3/load-bmfont

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration object with all parameters for bmfont.

params.name: texture
params.description: Texture with the image character atlas to be used.

params.name: shader
params.description: The text rendering shader to be used (Bitmap, SDF, MSDF).

params.name: color
params.description: Color of the text.

TextMesh.name: TextMesh
TextMesh.description:
Special mesh type used to draw 3D text.

It receives a Font resource that is used to triangulate and extrude font data into a 3D mesh.

params.name: text
params.description: Text to be draw

params.name: material
params.description: Material used to shade the superficie of the geometry

params.name: font
params.description: Font

params.name: height
params.description: Text height

TextSprite.name: TextSprite
TextSprite.description:
Text sprite is used to represent text as a sprite.

This approach is memory expensive since it needs to write a new texture for each text. But allows the used to access any font available in the browser.

The text is rendered to canvas and then copied to a texture. It automatically ajusts the object scale to match the text aspect.

Program.name: Program
Program.description:
Program class contains all the data of a nunuStudio program.

Is stores and manages all available resources used by the children objects.

Is responsible for handling runtime tasks, initialization, update, resizes etc.

Scene.name: Scene
Scene.description:
Scenes allow you to set up what and where is to be rendered by the engine.

This is where you place objects, lights and cameras.

A program may contain multiple scenes, its possible to change between scene using scripts.
 
Scene three.js documentation available here https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Scenes/Scene.

TargetConfig.name: TargetConfig
TargetConfig.description: Target configuration stores platform specific configurations used when exporting the application to a platform.

FXAAPass.name: FXAAPass
FXAAPass.description:
Fast approximate anti-aliasing (FXAA) is an anti-aliasing algorithm to smooth jagged edges on post procesing effects.

More information about FXAA available here:
 - https:// developer.download.nvidia.com/assets/gamedev/files/sdk/11/FXAA_WhitePaper.pdf

AfterimagePass.name: AfterimagePass
AfterimagePass.description:
After image render pass blends the current frame with the previous frame.

A dampening value is applied in the blend, that is performed additively.

params.name: strength
params.description: Bloom effect strength.

params.name: kernelSize
params.description: Bloom kernel size.

params.name: sigma
params.description: Sigma.

params.name: resolution
params.description: Bloom buffer resolution.

params.name: focus
params.description: Focus distance.

params.name: aperture
params.description: Camera aperture.

params.name: maxblur
params.description: Maximum level of blur.

ColorifyPass.name: ColorifyPass
ColorifyPass.description: Colorify pass can be used to colorify the scene.

CopyPass.name: CopyPass
CopyPass.description: Copy pass can be used to copy the actual content on the composer to the screen.

DotScreenPass.name: DotScreenPass
DotScreenPass.description: DotScreen pass generates a poster like effect on top of the scene.
DotScreenPass.author: alteredq / http:// alteredqualia.com/

params.name: center
params.description: Dot rotation center.

params.name: angle
params.description: Dot rotation angle.

params.name: scale
params.description: Dot scale.

FilmPass.name: FilmPass
FilmPass.description: Film pass is used to simulate a film/TV like effect.
FilmPass.author: alteredq / http:// alteredqualia.com/

params.name: hue
params.description: Hue rotation from -1 to 1

params.name: saturation
params.description: Color saturation from -1  to 1

SSAONOHPass.name: SSAONOHPass
SSAONOHPass.description:
Screen space ambient occlusion (SSAO) pass is used to simulate ambient occlusion shadowing effect.

Uses the normal-oriented hemisphere method produces a more realistic-looking than the basic Crysis method.

Based on the article from http:// john-chapman-graphics.blogspot.com/2013/01/ssao-tutorial.html

More information about SSAO here
 - http:// developer.download.nvidia.com/SDK/10.5/direct3d/Source/ScreenSpaceAO/doc/ScreenSpaceAO.pdf

SSAOPass.name: SSAOPass
SSAOPass.description:
Screen space ambient occlusion (SSAO) pass is used to simulate ambient occlusion shadowing effect.

This variant of SSAO produces a halo like effect to simulate the effect.

More information about SSAO here
 - http:// developer.download.nvidia.com/SDK/10.5/direct3d/Source/ScreenSpaceAO/doc/ScreenSpaceAO.pdf
SSAOPass.author: alteredq / http:// alteredqualia.com/

SobelPass.name: SobelPass
SobelPass.description: Sobel pass is used to create a edge highlight effect with a sobel operator.

UnrealBloomPass.name: UnrealBloomPass
UnrealBloomPass.description:
Unreal engine like bloom effect pass.

More information available here
 - https:// docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Engine/Rendering/PostProcessEffects/Bloom/
UnrealBloomPass.author: spidersharma / http:// eduperiment.com/

params.name: strength
params.description: Bloom effect strength.

params.name: radius
params.description: Bloom effect radius.

params.name: threshold
params.description: White point threshold.

SSAOShader.name: SSAOShader
SSAOShader.description:
Screen-space ambient occlusion shader
   - http:// devlog-martinsh.blogspot.com (assembled by Martins Upitis)
   - http:// www.gamedev.net/topic/550699-ssao-no-halo-artifacts/ (original technique is made by ArKano22)

Modified to use RGBA packed depth texture (use clear color 1,1,1,1 for depth pass)
SSAOShader.author: alteredq / http:// alteredqualia.com/

EffectComposer.name: EffectComposer
EffectComposer.description:
The effect composer is used to organize multiple post-processing passes.

It is used by camera objects to organize the rendering pipeline.

Pass.name: Pass
Pass.description:
A render Pass is used to render something in the graphics pipeline.

Can be used to render a scene, apply post processing effects, merge buffers,  etc.

RenderPass.name: RenderPass
RenderPass.description: Render pass is used to render the scene the same way as if were using the renderer directly.

ShaderPass.name: ShaderPass
ShaderPass.description: Shader pass is used to apply a post processing effect over an already rendered scene.
ShaderPass.author: alteredq / http:// alteredqualia.com/

CSS3DObject.name: CSS3DObject
CSS3DObject.description:
CSS 3D element projected in the 3D scene.

Encapsulated a DOM element that is projected into 3D space using the 3D object transform values.

CSS3D object always stay above everything elese in the 3D scene.

params.name: element
params.description: DOM element encapsulated in the object container.

CSS3DRenderer.name: CSS3DRenderer
CSS3DRenderer.description:
3D renderer using DOM elements.

Applies the threejs transformation hierarchy to the DOM element using CSS3D.

Only renders CSS specific objects, the output of the renderer is not combined with the WebGL output. Everything is renderer of top.

Based on the three.js adaptation (mrdoob, yomotsu) of http:// www.emagix.net/academic/mscs-project/item/camera-sync-with-css3-and-webgl-threejs

params.name: domElement
params.description: DOM division to place rendered objects.

CSS3DSprite.name: CSS3DSprite
CSS3DSprite.description:
CSS 3D element drawn as a billboard.

Always faces the screen orientation (does not rotate).

params.name: element
params.description: DOM element encapsulated in the object container.

RendererConfiguration.name: RendererConfiguration
RendererConfiguration.description: Renderer configuration stores all the WebGL renderer related parameters.

params.name: options
params.description: Options object with the values to be used in the rendere configuration, values not specified are set to default.

RendererState.name: RendererState
RendererState.description:
Renderer state can be used to store and restore a renderer state between postprocessing passes.

It stores the clean configurations of the renderer.

Audio.name: Audio
Audio.description: Audio class is used to store audio data as a arraybuffer to be later used by objects with the WebAudio API.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to Audio file or ArrayBuffer data.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Audio encoding (mp3, wav, etc).

Font.name: Font
Font.description:
Font class stores font data, font data can be stored as an  json or as a TTF file (stored in Base64).

Font objects are used to draw text using the TextMesh object and/or generate text bitmap.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to font file

Image.name: Image
Image.description:
Image class is used to store image data that is used to create Textures.

Images can be stored in mutiple formats.

Some formats (tga, tiff, etc) are converted to png or jpeg in order to work with the rest of the code.

params.name: data
params.description: Can be URL to image, ArrayBuffer data or base64 encoded data.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Image encoding, required for ArrayBuffer data.

Model.name: Model
Model.description:
Model is used to load and check file type for external 3D models, animations, scenes etc.

It wraps other threejs loaders and loads files using them depending on file format.

Resource.name: Resource
Resource.description:
Resource class is used to represent resources.

Resources store data that is used by objects.

ResourceManager.name: ResourceManager
ResourceManager.description:
Resource manager is used to manage available resources used by objects

The resource manager is used to extend Object3D elements and is not meant to be used as a standalone.

For standalone resource management use the resource container.

TextFile.name: TextFile
TextFile.description:
Text file resource can be used to store data or code.

Text file data can be used to store information to be consumend by the application or runtime code that can be imported by scripts.

Video.name: Video
Video.description:
Video resources are used to store video.

Video data stored in base64.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to video file.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Image encoding, required for ArrayBuffer data.

VideoStream.name: VideoStream
VideoStream.description: Video stream resource, used to load streamable video files directly from URL.

params.name: url
params.description: URL to video file.

params.name: encoding
params.description: Image encoding, required for ArrayBuffer data.

CanvasTexture.name: CanvasTexture
CanvasTexture.description:
Canvas textures can be used to draw content to the texture during runtime, using the context property.

Canvas textures always start with black background and a red text "Canvas Texture".

params.name: width
params.description: Canvas width

params.name: height
params.description: Canvas height

CompressedTexture.name: CompressedTexture
CompressedTexture.description:
CompressTexture class is used to store textures using GPU compatible compressed data.

The advantage of using these texture is the fact that the texture does not get uncompressed in the GPU memory saving not only project space but also saving video memory during runtime.

The problem with compressed textures is that its hardware dependent (they dont work everywhere)
- DXT: supported on desktop and some Android smartphones
- PVR: supported on iOS and some Android smartphones
- ETC1: supported by most Android smartphones

The usage of these format can free a lot of video memory and is a must for mobile devices.

params.name: mipmaps
params.description: Mipmaps levels

CubeTexture.name: CubeTexture
CubeTexture.description:
CubeTextures represent 360 view using six images, these images correspond to the faces of a cube.

CubeTextures can be used to simulate reflections and transparency refraction in materials.

Is also possible to create dynamic cubetextures using the CubeCamera object.

params.name: images
params.description: Image array

DataTexture.name: DataTexture
DataTexture.description:
Data texture stored binary RAW texture data values.

Can be used to store render target result or to load custom image formats. Pixels can be manipulated individually in the data array.

params.name: data
params.description: Image data array

SpriteSheetTexture.name: SpriteSheetTexture
SpriteSheetTexture.description:
SpriteSheet texture, can be used load spritesheet animations as textures.

The images have to be aligned in a grid without overlapping if the spritesheet is not full the last rows or blocks should be empty.

Images are played row by row, changing every animationSpeed seconds.

Texture.name: Texture
Texture.description:
Basic image texture object wraps a texture from a img DOM element

Support for GIF animations without playback controls.

VideoTexture.name: VideoTexture
VideoTexture.description:
Video texture, uses a video DOM element instead of a img element.

VideoTexture also provides methods for playback control.

WebcamTexture.name: WebcamTexture
WebcamTexture.description:
Webcam texture is used to capture and display video from a webcam in real-time.

It uses WebRTC, the host must support it, otherwise WebcamTexture will display a black image.

Object3D.name: Object3D
Object3D.description:
This is the base class for most objects in three.js and provides a set of properties and methods for manipulating objects in 3D space.

This page provides documentation for some of the main features of this class, the original documentation of this class can be found at https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Core/Object3D.

All nunuStudio objects extend the Object3D class of some other higher level class from three.js.

Material.name: Material
Material.description:
Materials describe the appearance of objects. They are defined in a (mostly) renderer-independent way, so you don"t have to rewrite materials if you decide to use a different renderer.

Original documentation available here https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Materials/Material

Skeleton.name: Skeleton
Skeleton.description: Use an array of bones to create a skeleton that can be used by a SkinnedMesh.

params.name: bones
params.description: Bone array.

params.name: boneInverses
params.description: An array of Matrix4.

Fog.name: Fog
Fog.description:
Fog class is used to store fog attributes attached to a Scene

Original documentation for fog available here https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Scenes/Fog and for exponential fog here https:// threejs.org/docs/index.html#Reference/Scenes/FogExp2

ArraybufferUtils.name: ArraybufferUtils
ArraybufferUtils.description: ArraybufferUtils contains methods to convert from and to ArrayBuffer binary format

Base64Utils.name: Base64Utils
Base64Utils.description: Base64Utils contains methods to convert from and to Base64 binary format.

BufferUtils.name: BufferUtils
BufferUtils.description: BufferUtils contains methods to convert from and to Node.js Buffer binary format

ByteArrayUtils.name: ByteArrayUtils
ByteArrayUtils.description:
ByteArrayUtils contains methods to convert from and to ByteArray binary format

A byte array is a numeric array that stores a 8 bit (0 to 255) value for each position.

Tree.name: Tree
Tree.description:
Tree structure used to represent Trees.

Every tree stores Trees as children and have a parent children.

If the parent is null then the Tree is the root.

TreeUtils.name: TreeUtils
TreeUtils.description:
TreeUtils used to compare Tree.

Can also be used to compare Object structure.

AnimationTimer.name: AnimationTimer
AnimationTimer.description:
Animation timer is a special type of timer that uses the requestAnimationFrame() method.

This timer calls the method with the same rate as the screen refresh rate.

params.name: callback
params.description: Timer callback function.

Timer.name: Timer
Timer.description:
Time is user to call functions in loop at a defined rate.

Loop time can be changed dynamically, it is readjusted on the next timer call.

params.name: callback
params.description: Callback task method called at the rate of the time.

params.name: Time
params.description: in ms to run the timer task.

WorkerPool.name: WorkerPool
WorkerPool.description:
Worker pool is used to manage and execute mutiple task of the same type using a predefined number of workers.

Workers are pre initialized to avoid the overhead of creation during execution.

These workers receive messages with a uuid of the task and the data to be processed.

{
  uuid: <Task UUID>,
  data: <Data object>
}

The worker should respond with a message using the same structure.

params.name: file
params.description: Worker JS file path.

params.name: size
params.description: Number of workers to be created for this pool.

WorkerTask.name: WorkerTask
WorkerTask.description: A worker task is processed by a worker pool.

params.name: data
params.description: Data to be sent to the worker.

params.name: callback
params.description: Function called when the task finishes.

EventManager.name: EventManager
EventManager.description:
EventManager is used to manager DOM events creationg and destruction in a single function call.

It is used by objects to make it easier to add, manager and remove events from DOM elements.

LocalStorage.name: LocalStorage
LocalStorage.description: Utils to access the browser local storage.

MathUtils.name: MathUtils
MathUtils.description: MathUtils contains auxiliar values and function to help with mathematical operations.

ObjectUtils.name: ObjectUtils
ObjectUtils.description: Object utils is a collection of methods to apply operations to Object3D instances.

PhysicsGenerator.name: PhysicsGenerator
PhysicsGenerator.description:
Physics generator is used to create Cannon.js shapes from three.js geometries.

Can be used with any object that contains a geometry.

It is based on the original Mesh2Shape converted by @donmccurdy.
PhysicsGenerator.author: tentone

UnitConverter.name: UnitConverter
UnitConverter.description:
The unit convertor is responsible for performing unit conversion between values.

Units are represented by their natural texture unit representation (m/s, km/s, n/m, etc).

ARHandler.name: ARHandler
ARHandler.description:
AR class handles all the agumented reality related tasks.

Can be used to detect if the host system is capable of displaying AR content and checks for the availability of WebXR with the required modes.

App.name: App
App.description:
Nunu app is the main class of the runtime system, is used to embed projects into external webpages and applications.

Project files can be loaded directly from their project files into any kind of project. The app class handles all the runtime and control of the application lifecycle.

params.name: canvas
params.description: Canvas to be used by the runtime, if no canvas is provided a new one is created and added to the document.body, to create a new App without canvas a null value can be passed.

FileSystem.name: FileSystem
FileSystem.description:
FileSystem is used to read and write files using nunuStudio.

Its implements multiple solutions for each method depending on the platform (NodeJS, brower or cordova).

Some operations are platform specific and might not work everywhere.

Nunu.name: Nunu
Nunu.description:
nunuStudio core main file.

Store development version, timestamp and contains global method to check browser feature support.

VRHandler.name: VRHandler
VRHandler.description:
VR class handles all the virtual reality related tasks.

Can be used to detect if the host system is capable of displaying VR content and checks for the availability of WebXR and/or WebVR.

classitems.description: Get distance model in use by this audio emitter.
classitems.name: getDistanceModel

classitems.description:
Set distance model to be used.

Distance model defined how the emitter controls its volume from its position in the world, relative to the camera.

By default the mode used is "inverse", can be also set to:
 - "linear": A linear distance model calculating the gain induced by the distance according to
   - 1 - rolloffFactor * (distance - refDistance) / (maxDistance - refDistance)
 - "inverse": An inverse distance model calculating the gain induced by the distance according to:
   - refDistance / (refDistance + rolloffFactor * (distance - refDistance))
 - "exponential": An exponential distance model calculating the gain induced by the distance according to:
   - pow(distance / refDistance, -rolloffFactor).
classitems.name: setDistanceModel

params.description: Distance Model to be used.

Any particle"s alive will be allowed to finish their lifecycle.

classitems.description:
Set this value to however many "steps" you want value-over-lifetime properties to have.

Its adjustable to fix an interpolation problem:

Assuming you specify an opacity value as [0, 1, 0] and the valueOverLifetimeLength is 4, then the opacity value array will be reinterpolated to be [0, 0.66, 0.66, 0].
This isn't ideal, as particles would never reach full opacity.

This property affects the length of ALL value-over-lifetime properties for ALL  emitters and ALL groups. Only values >= 3 && <= 4 are allowed.
classitems.name: valueOverLifetimeLength

classitems.description:
Python code attached to the script.

It only has acess to the data provided as parameter in each method.
- initialize(obj, scene, program, keyboard, mouse) 
   - Called on app initialization, its called after all children elements are initialized, its safe to apply operations on other objects inside this method.
 - update(delta, obj, scene, program, keyboard, mouse)
   - Called on every frame after rendering
 - dispose(obj, scene, program, keyboard, mouse)
   - Called when disposing the program
 - onMouseOver(intersections, obj, scene, program, keyboard, mouse)
   - Called on every frame if mouse is on top of one of the script children
   - Receives an intersections array as argument.
 - onResize(x, y, obj, scene, program, keyboard, mouse)
   - Called every time the window is resized
   - Receives width and height as parameters
 - onAppData(data, obj, scene, program, keyboard, mouse)
   - Called when receiving data sent by the host website

classitems.description:
Source code attached to the script, by default it is a Javacript source but other languages can be implemented.

It can access and change every object in the program and supports some events
- initialize
   - Called on app initialization, its called after all children elements are initialized, its safe to apply operations on other objects inside this method.
 - update(delta)
   - Called on every frame after rendering
 - dispose
   - Called when disposing the program
 - onMouseOver(intersections)
   - Called on every frame if mouse is on top of one of the script children
   - Receives an intersections array as argument.
 - onResize(x, y)
   - Called every time the window is resized
   - Receives width and height as parameters
 - onAppData(data)
   - Called when receiving data sent by the host website

Code written inside scripts have access to the following attributes:
 - scene
 - program
 - self
   - Same as this reference but global in the script scope
 - Keyboard
 - Mouse

There is also access to the following functions
 - include
   - Include a javascript file from resources, when including files the user needs to be carefull and clear manually global declarations. The access to this method may be restricted depeding on the include mode
classitems.name: code

classitems.description:
Mode indicates how to include external javascripts files into the script.

Can be APPEND, EVALUATE or INCLUDE.

APPEND mode with append the library code to the script code, when running in this mode the include method cannot be used during runtime

EVALUATE node with evaluate the library code during runtime, include method may still be used.

INCLUDE mode will include the file as a global script, these libraries are not unloaded after the script or application is terminated.

classitems.description:
BMFont text configuration object.

Passed to the BMFont text geometry generator. It is a object with the format.

{
   font: (Object) Font data should be parsed from (.json, .fnt, etc) file,
   text: (String),
   width: (Number) Width of the text area,
   align: (String) Side to align the text,
   lineHeight: (Number) Line height/font size,
   letterSpacing: (Number) Spacing between characters,
   mode: (String) a mode for word-wrapper; can be 'pre' (maintain spacing), or 'nowrap' (collapse whitespace but only break on newline characters), otherwise assumes normal word-wrap behaviour (collapse whitespace, break at width or newlines)
   tabSize: (Number) the number of spaces to use in a single tab (default 4)
   start: (Number) the starting index into the text to layout (default 0)
   end: (Number) the ending index (exclusive) into the text to layout (default text.length)
}

classitems.description:
Serialize the object data to JSON. Should serialize all attributes and resources used by the object.

Parsing of the data serialized is performed using the ObjectLoader class.

The objects being serialized share a "meta" object where the resources can be stored to avoid repetition in the serialized data.

On the root object the meta object does not need to be initialized manually it is automatically created, to access resource the resourceAccess callback should be used.
classitems.name: toJSON

params.name: meta
params.description: Resource storage passed to all resources toJSON for self storage.

params.name: resourceAccess
params.description: Callback method used to access the resources receives (meta, object) as parameters, meta is the resource storage and object is the current serialized status of the object new attributes can be added here.

params.name: recursive
params.description: If true the method will call toJSON for all available children and store the result in children attribute.

return.description: json Output JSON will all data serialized, this can be stores in file or transfered to later be loaded using the ObjectLoader.

classitems.description:
Write text to a file.

When running on the web it writes file to a blob and auto downloads it.
classitems.name: writeFile

params.name: fname
params.description: Name/path of the file to write.

params.name: data
params.description: Text to be written to the file.

params.name: sync
params.description: If true the file is written syncronously. (Only available for Nodejs).

params.name: onFinish
params.description: Callback function called when the file is written.

classitems.description:
Write binary file using base64 data.

If running on the web writes the file into a blob and auto downloads it.
classitems.name: writeFileBase64

params.name: fname
params.description: Name/path of the file to write.

params.name: data
params.description: Base64 data to be written into the file.

params.name: sync
params.description: If true the file is written syncronously. (Only available for Nodejs)

params.name: onFinish
params.description: Callback function called when the file is written.

classitems.description:
Write binary file using arraybuffer data. 

If running on the web writes the file into a blob and auto downloads it.
classitems.name: writeFileArrayBuffer

params.name: fname
params.description: Name/path of the file to write.

params.name: data
params.description: Arraybuffer data to be written into the file.

params.name: sync
params.description: If true the file is written syncronously. (Only available for Nodejs)

params.name: onFinish
params.description: Callback function called when the file is written.

classitems.description:
Choose a file path/name to create a new file and write it to the system.

Depending on the platform opens a file path selection windows of a box to select the name of the file.
classitems.name: chooseFileWrite

params.name: onLoad
params.description: onLoad callback that receives the path select to write the file.

params.name: filter
params.description: File type filter (e.g. ".zip,.rar").

classitems.description:
Open file chooser dialog window for the user to select a directory.

Only works while using NWJS.
classitems.name: chooseDirectory

return.description: Promise that resolves with the selected path.

classitems.description:
Open file chooser dialog window for the user to select files stored in the system.

The files selected are retrieved using the onLoad callback that receives a array of File objects.
classitems.name: chooseFile

params.name: onLoad
params.description: onLoad callback that receives array of files as parameter.

params.name: filter
params.description: File type filter (e.g. .zip, .rar).

params.name: saveas
params.description: File format or name to be used, optinonally it can be a boolean value indicating savemode.

params.name: multiFile
params.description: If true the chooser will accept multiple files.

classitems.description:
Used as an alternative to chooseFile for saving files in the browser.

Uses a prompt to question the user the file name.
classitems.name: chooseFileName

params.name: onLoad
params.description: onLoad callback

params.name: saveas
params.description: File extension

classitems.description:
Copy file (cannot be used to copy folders).

Only works when running inside NWJS.
classitems.name: copyFile

classitems.description:
Make a directory (dont throw exeption if directory already exists).

Only works when running inside NWJS.
classitems.name: makeDirectory

classitems.description:
Returns files in directory (returns empty array in case of error).

Only works when running inside NWJS.
classitems.name: getFilesDirectory

classitems.description:
Delete folders and all subfolders.

Only works when running inside NWJS.
classitems.name: deleteFolder

classitems.description:
Copy folder and all its files (includes symbolic links).

Only works when running inside NWJS.
classitems.name: copyFolder

classitems.description:
Check if a file exists.

Only works inside of NWJS. When running inside the browser always returns false.
classitems.name: fileExists

params.name: file
params.description: File path

classitems.description:
Get file name without extension from file path string.

If input is a/b/c/abc.d output is abc.
classitems.name: getFileName

params.name: file
params.description: File path

return.description: File name without path and extension

classitems.description:
Get file name with extension from file path string.

If input is a/b/c/abc.d output is abc.d.
classitems.name: getFileNameWithExtension

params.name: file
params.description: File path

return.description: File name without path with extension

classitems.description:
Get file name without extension.

If input is a/b/c/abc.d output is a/b/c/abc.
classitems.name: getNameWithoutExtension

params.name: file
params.description: File path

classitems.description:
Get directory where the file is placed.

If input is a/b/c/abc.d output is a/b/c/
classitems.name: getFilePath

params.name: file
params.description: File path

classitems.description:
Get file extension from file path string (always in lowercase).

If input is a/b/c/abc.d output is d.
classitems.name: getFileExtension

params.name: file
params.description: File path

classitems.description: Aplication name (might be usefull if getting the module as a unnamed export)
classitems.name: NAME

classitems.description: Stores the runtime version.
classitems.name: VERSION

classitems.description: Stores the timestamp of the application build.
classitems.name: TIMESTAMP

classitems.description: Repository branch, used to track the version after publishing.
classitems.name: REPOSITORY_BRANCH

classitems.description: Repository commit uuid, used to track the version after publishing.
classitems.name: REPOSITORY_COMMIT

classitems.description:
Indicates if the application/library is being used in development mode.

Can be usefull to restrict development functionality when building to production.
classitems.name: DEVELOPMENT

classitems.description: NWJS platform, used for desktop version.
classitems.name: NWJS

classitems.description: Running inside of a regular web browser.
classitems.name: BROWSER

classitems.description: Cordova platform, used for mobile versions.
classitems.name: CORDOVA

classitems.description:
Import stuff from a namespace to another target namespace.

If not target is specified window is used.
classitems.name: copyNamespace

classitems.description: Get the query parameter from the browser URL.
classitems.name: getQueryParameters

return.description: Object with parameters read from the URL.

classitems.description:
Create a web worker from code written in a string.

Uses a blob to inject the code and loads it from and URL object.
classitems.name: createWorker

params.name: code
params.description: Javascript code for this worker.

params.name: onMessage
params.description: On message worker callback.

classitems.description: Check if host supports WebAudio.
classitems.name: webAudioAvailable

classitems.description: Check if host supports WebGL, only checks for WebGL 1.0 support.
classitems.name: webglAvailable

classitems.description:
Check in wich platform the enviroment is running.

Possible return values are:
- Nunu.NWJS
- Nunu.BROWSER
- Nunu.CORDOVA
classitems.name: getPlatform

classitems.description: Check if nunu is running inside NWJS.
classitems.name: runningOnDesktop

classitems.description:
Open a webpage on a new window.

On desktop and mobile it will open the default browser.

On the web it will open as a popup.
classitems.name: openWebpage

classitems.description:
Check if there is some element on fullscreen mode.

Returns true even the fullscreen element is not related with the app.
classitems.name: isFullscreen

return.description: True if there is some element in fullscreen mode.

classitems.description:
Set an element into fullscreen mode or exit out of fullscreen mode.

Uses isFullscreen to check if the application is running in fullscreen mode already.
classitems.name: setFullscreen

params.name: fullscreen
params.description: If true the application will enter fullscreen mode, if false it will exit, if undefine it will toggle the value.

params.name: element
params.description: DOM element to put into fullscreen.

classitems.description:
Flag checking if there is support for XR immersive VR mode.

Checked on the library startup if XR is supported, while the check does not finish it is set to null.
classitems.name: webXRSupported

classitems.description: WebXR session if there is one active.
classitems.name: webXRSession

classitems.description:
Flag indicating if there are any VR displays available.

Checked on the library bootup if WebVR is available, while the check does not finish it is set to null.
classitems.name: webVRHasDisplay

classitems.description: WebVR display if there is one active.
classitems.name: webVRDisplay

classitems.description:
Check if there is any VR API available, on the device.

Checks if there is support for WebVR or WebXR.
classitems.name: vrAvailable

return.description: True if the browser supports vr.

classitems.description:
Enter virtual reality mode using WebXR or WebVR depending on the API available.

If booth API are available the WebXR API is used.

When displaying VR content the display.requestAnimationFrame should be used to call the render method.
classitems.name: enterVR

params.name: renderer
params.description: Renderer used to draw the scene.

params.name: onSuccess
params.description: Method called if the application entered VR successfully.

classitems.description: Enter virtual reality mode, if the application is not running on VR mode does not do anything.
classitems.name: exitVR

params.name: renderer
params.description: Renderer used to draw the scene.

classitems.description: Get WebXR session.
classitems.name: getXRSession

return.description: Promise used to get the XR session, receives the session as argument.

classitems.description: Used to get the first VR display available, the display is returned as argument of the onDisplay function.
classitems.name: getVRDisplays

return.description: Promise used to get the display, receives the display as argument.
